page.title: 05Fulwood After The War.
page.content: In World War II there was no television. Our speaker went to school by bus. She used coupons for sweets. She had to take a gas mask to school in a cardboard box in case there was an air-raid. She went blackberry picking in the summer. She had a fountain pen and a scratcher pen, biros were not out. When she was young there were no playschools. Clothes were different to the ones today. Policemen were on bikes. People did not have contact lenses. She wore a hat for school. They had cinemas on Saturday mornings, there were special films for children. There were no motorways. The hospitals were different than they are today. People had watches but not like they are today. The teachers were very strict. When she spelt draw wrong she got the cane.
